article.headline: Brigham Young 73, Liberty 59
article.story: PROVO, Utah (AP) -- Keena Young scored a game-high 17 points, including 13 in the second half, to help Brigham Young to a 73-59 win over Liberty Thursday in the BYU Holiday Classic. BYU (8-4) used a 13-2 run capped by a Trent Plaisted free throw to stretch a four point halftime lead to 15 at 42-27 with 13:53 left in the game. Liberty (6-5) had a 9-4 run of its own to close the Cougar lead to seven at 51-44 on three consecutive 3-pointers by Tyler Baker and Dwight Brewington with 8:21 remaining, but couldn't pull any closer. The Cougars were hot from the field in the second half, connecting on 59 percent of their shots compared to 34 percent in the first half. BYU also controlled the boards in the second half with a 20-10 rebound advantage, 40-29 for the game. Sam Burgess came off the bench for BYU to score 12 while Plaisted and Rashaun Broadus scored 11 and 10 points respectively. Alex McLean had a game-high 10 rebounds and led the Flames in scoring along with Brewington at 14 points each. The victory improved BYU's home winning streak to 21 games. Thursday was the first day of the three-day round-robin tournament hosted by BYU.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
